Kayako - ticket id 60256250 // ATLAS commented publicly: Dear Karuna,

Thank you for outlining the situation where users are required to refresh the page to successfully post replies within your Khoros Classic Community at https://community.se.com. Based on the information provided and standard Khoros Community behavior, the reply box should open immediately beneath a post when clicking Reply, allowing the user to respond inline—no page refresh should be necessary under normal circumstances.

This behavior can be disrupted by several factors. Below are troubleshooting steps and technical explanations based on documented platform usage:

 	* Session Token Expiry: Khoros Communities rely on an active session for posting replies. If there is a significant delay between opening the reply box and submitting the reply, the user’s session or post token may expire, causing the reply button to fail until the page is refreshed and a new token is generated. Users should post replies soon after opening the reply box.
 	* Browser Caching or Extensions: Cached scripts or conflicts from browser extensions can interfere with core functionalities like inline replies. The issue may be isolated by clearing the browser cache, disabling extensions, or using an incognito/private window. Switching browsers or devices can also help determine if the issue is environment-specific.
 	* Expected Workflow: Standard functionality for replying is detailed here: Replying in a Forum with threaded inline replies [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125575]. If users are consistently required to refresh—even in clean browser sessions—it is not the intended Khoros behavior. Normally, users should see their reply immediately posted inline with the topic.
 	* Customization Conflicts: If the community instance uses custom scripts or browser plugins, these could potentially interfere with post actions. Temporarily disabling these customizations can assist in isolating any related issues.
 	* Error Observation: If any error messages are presented in the browser console during failed reply attempts, these can be critical in further pinpointing the source of the problem.

For best results, users encountering this issue should:

 	* Post replies soon after opening the reply box to avoid session timeout.
 	* Use an updated browser, clear cached data, and disable browser add-ons to rule out local interference.
 	* Consult the documentation on expected reply functionality: Replying in a Forum with threaded inline replies [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125575].
 	* If possible, check for errors in the browser’s console, which can provide more technical clues if the issue persists despite the above steps.

If after following these practices the issue remains consistent across multiple users and browsers, it may indicate a more systemic technical condition within the community instance, such as a persistent script or session misconfiguration. In such cases, continued technical review is advised to ensure the base configuration and any customizations align with documented Khoros Classic Community behaviors.

For your reference, additional information on how threaded inline replies should function is provided here: Replying in a Forum with threaded inline replies [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125575]. This includes information on layout, inline posting, and feature expectations.

If you observe any recurring error messages or other patterns during failed reply attempts, those technical details would be valuable for further analysis. Please consult the aforementioned guidelines to mitigate the issue and use the documentation to compare with the intended platform behavior.

Sincerely,
Atlas
Khoros Community Classic Support Team.

Kayako - ticket id 60256250 // ATLAS commented publicly: Dear Karuna,

Thank you for providing the additional details regarding the issue where users must refresh the page to reply to a post within your Khoros Classic Community at https://community.se.com.

Based on the description, it appears that affected users are encountering a problem where the reply function does not immediately allow posting, and in some cases, requires repeated refreshing. This is not the expected behavior in Khoros Communities. Normally, when a user clicks Reply, the reply box should open directly below the post for inline response, and subsequent replies should post without requiring a page refresh. Additional features such as dragging or browsing to attach files are also supported in this interface (see details here [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125575]).

This issue could be caused by several factors, including browser caching, script conflicts, or session timeouts. Here are some ways users can attempt to resolve or further narrow down the issue:

 	* Browser/Device: Please verify if the issue occurs across multiple browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari) and whether it persists in private/incognito mode. Sometimes browser extensions or cached data can interfere with reply functionality.
 	* Session Timing: Khoros Communities may require an active session to reply. If a user takes too long before submitting a reply, the session or post token may expire, causing issues with posting. Advise users to reply within a reasonable time after opening the reply box.
 	* Error Messages: If there is a specific error displayed in the browser console, it might provide additional clues. Users can press F12 (or Option+Cmd+I on Mac) to open the console, attempt to reply, and check for errors.

Steps to help mitigate and test this behavior:

 	* Clear browser cache and cookies for the site.
 	* Disable any ad blockers or browser extensions and try again.
 	* Attempt to reply in an incognito/private window.
 	* Ensure the browser is updated to the latest version.
 	* Try using a different device or network to rule out environmental factors.

If your community uses custom scripts or plugins, temporarily disabling them can help determine if a customization may be interfering with core functionality.

For more information on how inline replies are intended to function, please see the official documentation: Replying in a Forum with threaded inline replies [https://khoros-classic.kayako.com/article/125575].

If this issue happens consistently even after these steps, and no errors are observed in the browser console, it may indicate a deeper technical issue with the community instance beyond normal configuration and usage. In such cases, ensuring all community admin settings align with expected defaults may help further isolate the root cause.

Let us know if you have any additional details from the browser console or further observations, and we will continue to help diagnose the problem.

Sincerely,
Atlas
Khoros Community Classic Support Team.

-------------------------
